sen.j: 仏舎利塔（ぶっしゃりとう）とは、仏舎利（釈迦牟尼の遺骨）を納めるとされる仏塔。
sen.e: Bussharito is a Buddhist pagoda that allegedly contains Busshari (cremains of Shakamuni-butsu).
Bussharito is a Buddhist pagoda that allegedly contains Busshari (remains of Shakamuni-butsu).
Bussharito is a Buddhist pagoda that allegedly contains Busshari (remains of Shakamuni-butsu).

sen.j: 一般に仏塔の原型であるインドの「ストゥーパ」の様式をそのまま模して建てられた仏教建築物である。
sen.e: Generally, bussharito is a Buddhist architecture built modeled after 'stupa' in India, which is the original form of Buddhist pagoda.
Generally, bussharito is a Buddhist structure modeled after 'stupa' in India, which is the original form of Buddhist pagodas.
Generally, bussharito is a Buddhist structure modeled after 'stupa' in India, which is the original form of Buddhist pagodas.

sen.j: ドーム状の構造物の上に相輪をもつ。
sen.e: It has a Sorin (metal pinnacle) on a centroclinal architecture.
It has a Sorin (metal pinnacle) on a cylindrical architecture.
It has a Sorin (metal pinnacle) on a domy structure.
sen.cmt: cylindrical architectureをdomy structureに変更しました。

sen.j: 日本では近代になって建てられたものも多い。
sen.e: In Japan, many were built in modern times.
In Japan, many were built in modern times.
In Japan, many were built in modern times.

sen.j: また本来の舎利を祀るだけでなく、太平洋戦争でなくなった英霊を祀る仏舎利塔もある。
sen.e: There are also bussharito that enshrine sprits of the war dead in the Pacific War, as well as original bussharito that enshrine busshari.
There are also bussharito that enshrine spirits of the war dead in the Pacific War, as well as original bussharito that enshrine busshari.
There are also bussharito that enshrine spirits of the war dead in the Pacific War, as well as original bussharito that enshrine busshari.

sen.j: 中華人民共和国では「仏舎利塔」のことを「覆鉢式塔」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In People's Republic of China, 'bussharito' is called 'fukubachishiki (inverted bowl style) pagoda'.
In the People's Republic of China, 'bussharito' is called 'fukubachishiki (inverted bowl style) pagoda.'
In the People's Republic of China, 'bussharito' is called 'fukubachishiki (inverted bowl style) pagoda.'

sen.j: チベット仏教の仏塔である。
sen.e: They are pagodas in Tibetan Buddhism.
They are pagodas in Tibetan Buddhism.
They are pagodas of Tibetan Buddhism.

sen.j: 覆鉢式塔のつくりはストゥーパのつくりと基本的に同じで、南北朝時代 (中国)の雲岡石窟の中にすでに覆鉢式塔の造形が見られた。
sen.e: How to build fukubachishiki pagoda is basically the same as how to build stupa, and fukubachishiki architecture was already seen in Unko Grottoes (Yungang Grottoes) in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.

How to build fukubachishiki pagoda is basically the same as how to build stupa, and fukubachishiki architecture was already seen in Unko Grottoes (Yungang Grottoes) in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.

The structure of fukubachishiki pagoda is basically the same as that of stupa, and fukubachishiki architecture was already seen in Unko Grottoes (Yungang Grottoes) in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 早い時期にチベットに伝わり、チベットから各地に広まった。
sen.e: It came to Tibet in early times and spread from Tibet to many areas.
It came to Tibet in early times and spread from Tibet to many areas.
It came to Tibet in early times and spread from Tibet to many areas.

sen.j: ストゥーパは、やがて中華人民共和国で宝塔として形を変えていった。
sen.e: Stupa eventually changed its shape to hoto (treasure pagoda) in People's Republic of China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Stupa eventually changed its shape to hoto (treasure pagoda) in the People's Republic of China.
Stupa eventually changed its shape to hoto (treasure pagoda) in the People's Republic of China.

sen.j: しかし、元 (王朝)の時代に入るとチベット仏教が盛んになり、再び、インドのストゥーパが中華人民共和国に入ってきた。
sen.e: However, in the Yuan dynasty period, Tibetan Buddhism became popular and Indian stupa came to People's Republic of China again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the Yuan dynasty period, Tibetan Buddhism became popular and Indian stupa came to the People's Republic of China again.
However, in the Yuan dynasty period, Tibetan Buddhism became popular and Indian stupa flowed back into the People's Republic of China.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: そして、漢民族の住む地区にも建てられるようになった。
sen.e: Then, they were also built in areas where the Han race live.
Then, they were also built in areas where the Han race live.
Then, they were also built in areas where the Han race live.

sen.j: 覆鉢式塔は崇拝のために使われる。
sen.e: Fukubachishiki pagoda is used for worship.
Fukubachishiki pagoda is used for worship.
Fukubachishiki pagoda is used for worship.

sen.j: 中には舎利が収められ、また、高僧の墓としても使われる。
sen.e: Inside are cremains and it is also used as a grave of high priest.
Inside are remains and it is also used as a grave for the high priest.
It contains Shari (Buddha's relics) inside and it is also used as a grave for the high priest.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 覆鉢式塔の中は空洞になっていない。
sen.e: Fukubachishiki pagoda is not hollow.
Fukubachishiki pagodas are not hollow.
Fukubachishiki pagodas are not hollow.

sen.j: 大きさは大小まちまちである。
sen.e: There are various sizes.
There are various sizes.
There are various sizes.

sen.j: 中華人民共和国に現存するもっとも大きい覆鉢式塔は元 (王朝)の時代に立てられた北京市の妙慶寺（白塔寺）の白塔である。
sen.e: The biggest fukubachishiki pagoda that exists in the People's Republic of China is the white stupa in Miaoying Temple (White Stupa Temple) in Beijing City that was built in the Yuan dynasty period.
The biggest fukubachishiki pagoda that exists in the People's Republic of China is the white stupa in Miaoying Temple (White Stupa Temple) in Beijing City that was built in the Yuan dynasty period.
The biggest fukubachishiki pagoda that exists in the People's Republic of China is the white stupa in Miaoying Temple (White Stupa Temple) in Beijing City that was built in the Yuan dynasty period.

sen.j: これ以外にも北海公園の永安寺白塔などがある。
sen.e: Other than this, there are white stupa in Yoan-ji Temple in Beihai Park, etc.
Other than this, there are white stupa in Yoan-ji Temple in Beihai Park, etc.
Other than this, there are white stupa in Yoan-ji Temple in Beihai Park, etc.

sen.j: 日本の仏舎利塔は、飛鳥時代の法興寺・法隆寺・四天王寺のように、古くは木造の五重塔や三重塔として建造される例が多かったが、近代になると戦後の平和を願うなどの目的で北海道釧路市の城山や、静岡県御殿場市の平和公園 (御殿場市)、富山県高岡市の鉢伏山 (富山県高岡市)などの仏舎利塔が建造された。
sen.e: In ancient Japan, many bussharito were built as wooden five-storied pagodas or three-storied pagodas such as Hoko-ji Temple, Horyu-ji Temple, and Shitenno-ji Temple in the Asuka period, but in recent times, bussharito were built for peace in the post war period etc. such as Shiroyama in Kushiro City, Hokkaido, Heiwa Park in Gotenba City, Shizuoka Prefecture, and Hachibuseyama Mountain in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture, etc.

In ancient Japan, many bussharito were built as wooden five-storied pagodas or three-storied pagodas such as Hoko-ji Temple, Horyu-ji Temple, and Shitenno-ji Temple in the Asuka period, but in recent times, bussharito were built for peace in the post war period etc. such as Shiroyama in Kushiro City, Hokkaido, Heiwa Park in Gotenba City, Shizuoka Prefecture, and Hachibuseyama Mountain in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture, etc.

In ancient Japan, many bussharito were built as wooden five-storied pagodas or three-storied pagodas such as Hoko-ji Temple, Horyu-ji Temple, and Shitenno-ji Temple in the Asuka period, but in recent times, bussharito were built for peace in the post war period etc. such as Shiroyama in Kushiro City, Hokkaido, Heiwa Park in Gotenba City, Shizuoka Prefecture, and Mt. Hachibuse in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture, etc.
sen.cmt: Hachibuseyama MountainをMt. Hachibuseに変更しました。
